member.summary: Gets the file version as a string.

member.name: M:Skybrud.Umbraco.GridData.GridUtils.GetDaysSinceStart
member.summary: Gets the amount of days between the date of this build and the date the project was started - that is the 30th of July, 2012.

member.summary: Gets the date of this build of Skybrud.Social.

member.summary: Gets the build number of the day. This is mostly used for internal purposes to distinguish builds with the same assembly version.

member.name: T:Skybrud.Umbraco.GridData.Howdy
member.summary: Internal class referencing stuff from Umbraco 7.3, which isn't available in Umbraco 7.2. Since only this class is referencing code in Umbraco 7.3, we can make a release that works for both Umbraco 7.2.x and 7.3.x.

member.summary: Gets an array of all editors allowed for this area. If AllowAll is TRUE, this array may be empty.

member.summary: Gets an array of all controls added to this area.

member.summary: Gets a dictionary representing the styles of the area.

member.summary: Gets a dictionary representing the configuration (called Settings in the backoffice) of the area.

member.summary: Gets a reference to the previous area.

member.summary: Gets a reference to the next area.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Umbraco.GridData.GridArea.HasControls
member.summary: Gets whether the area has any controls.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Umbraco.GridData.GridArea.FirstControl
member.summary: Gets the first control of the area. If the area doesn't contain any controls, this property will return NULL.

member.name: P:Skybrud.Umbraco.GridData.GridArea.LastControl
member.summary: Gets the last control of the area. If the area doesn't contain any controls, this property will return NULL.

member.name: T:Skybrud.Umbraco.GridData.PiggyBank
member.summary:
This project started out as a proof of concept for and with my colleague Ren Pjengaard. While I couldn't think of a proper name at the time, the name of this class was mostly to annoy Ren.
The class has now been replaced by GridContext, but this class is left behind for good memories. It is however not recommended to use this class.
